intro: Eupatorium sullivaniae, commonly known as the Florida blue mistflower, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, thriving in moist to wet soils. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a silvery underside, contributing to its ornamental value. Eupatorium sullivaniae plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining wetland ecosystems.
